qas.question: Where did Igor get warriors from after returning to Kiev after being drivin out by the Byzatines?
When did the Rus return to Byzatine seeking revenge?
IN what year was the peace treaty signed between the Rus,  Byzantine and the Bulgarians.
What was Igor not keen on?
Who dismantled a large force of warriors among the Slav and Pecheneg?
What year did the Rus force retreat again?
What did the Rus reject from the Emperor?
What year did the Rus defeat the Byzantines the the Bulgarians?

context: <b4_0>Igor<b4_0/> returned to Kiev keen for <b3_0>revenge<b3_0/>. He assembled a large force of warriors from among neighboring <a0_0>Slavs and Pecheneg allies<a0_0/>, and sent for reinforcements of Varangians from “beyond the sea.” In <a1_0><b5_0>944<b5_0/><a1_0/> the Rus' force advanced again on the Greeks, by land and sea, and a Byzantine force from Cherson responded. The Emperor sent <b6_0>gifts and offered tribute<b6_0/> in lieu of war, and the Rus' accepted. Envoys were sent between the Rus’, the Byzantines, and the Bulgarians in <a2_0><b7_0>945<b7_0/><a2_0/>, and a peace treaty was completed. The agreement again focused on trade, but this time with terms less favorable to the Rus’, including stringent regulations on the conduct of Rus’ merchants in Cherson and Constantinople and specific punishments for violations of the law. The Byzantines may have been motivated to enter the treaty out of concern of a prolonged alliance of the Rus', Pechenegs, and Bulgarians against them, though the more favorable terms further suggest a shift in power.
